metadata.title: CVE-2015-1332 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The oxide::JavaScriptDialogManager function in oxide-qt before 1.9.1 aspackaged in Ubuntu 15.04 and Ubuntu 14.04 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (application crash) or execute arbitrary code via acrafted website.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1332` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqmlscene - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
